title: How to Grill Lamb

steps.headline: Season the loin chops.
steps.description: Spread olive oil on either side of your lamb chops and add the seasoning of your choice. Some typical seasonings are salt, pepper or dried rosemary.

steps.headline: Grill the loin chops.
steps.description: Let the meat cook for 4 to 5 minutes on each side before turning it over. Cook the loin chops until they are grilled to your liking.

steps.headline: Set the meat out to cool.
steps.description: Allowing the meat to cool for about 5 minutes before you eat it will help the juices settle and give you a more flavorful piece of lamb.

steps.headline: Combine ground lamb with your choice of ingredients.
steps.description: Some popular choices include diced onions, salt, pepper and parsley.

steps.headline: Mold your ground lamb into individual burger patties.
Brush the patties with olive oil or your choice of marinade to add more flavor to your lamb burgers.
Grill the patties.
steps.description: Cooking each side of the burger for around 4 minutes should result in a medium rare lamb burger. Cook longer on each side if you want the burger more well done.

steps.headline: Cut the lamb meat into bite sized cubes several hours before grilling.
steps.description: This will help the meat to cook faster once it's placed on the grill.

steps.headline: Marinate the meat.
steps.description: Combine the cuts of meat with your personal choice of marinade. Popular marinades include combinations of olive oil, garlic and lemon juice. Allow the lamb to soak up the marinade for several hours before grilling.

steps.headline: Thread the lamb cuts through a skewer.
steps.description: Allow at least 1/2 inch (12.7 mm) of space between each cube.

steps.headline: Place the lamb kabobs on the grill perpendicular to the grates and cook them to your desired temperature.
Marinade the leg of lamb.
steps.description: Popular marinades include a combination of onion, lemon juice and olive oil. Let the lamb soak in the marinade while in the refrigerator for 24 hours.

steps.headline: Season the lamb.
steps.description: After the lamb is done marinating, season it with spices like salt, pepper or garlic powder.

steps.headline: Grill the leg of lamb.
steps.description: Grill the cut of lamb on high for 3-4 minutes on either side. Lower the heat and cover your grill for up to 15 additional minutes to cook your leg of lamb the way you like it.

steps.headline: Allow the juices to settle.
steps.description: Letting your leg of lamb cool after grilling will make a more flavorful meat.

text: Grill Lamb Loin Chops Season the loin chops. Spread olive oil on either side of your lamb chops and add the seasoning of your choice. Some typical seasonings are salt, pepper or dried rosemary. Grill the loin chops. Let the meat cook for 4 to 5 minutes on each side before turning it over. Cook the loin chops until they are grilled to your liking. Set the meat out to cool. Allowing the meat to cool for about 5 minutes before you eat it will help the juices settle and give you a more flavorful piece of lamb. Grill Lamb Burgers Combine ground lamb with your choice of ingredients. Some popular choices include diced onions, salt, pepper and parsley. Mold your ground lamb into individual burger patties.  Brush the patties with olive oil or your choice of marinade to add more flavor to your lamb burgers.  Grill the patties. Cooking each side of the burger for around 4 minutes should result in a medium rare lamb burger. Cook longer on each side if you want the burger more well done. Grill Lamb Kabobs Cut the lamb meat into bite sized cubes several hours before grilling. This will help the meat to cook faster once it's placed on the grill. Marinate the meat. Combine the cuts of meat with your personal choice of marinade. Popular marinades include combinations of olive oil, garlic and lemon juice. Allow the lamb to soak up the marinade for several hours before grilling. Thread the lamb cuts through a skewer. Allow at least 1/2 inch (12.7 mm) of space between each cube. Place the lamb kabobs on the grill perpendicular to the grates and cook them to your desired temperature.  Grill Leg Of Lamb Marinade the leg of lamb. Popular marinades include a combination of onion, lemon juice and olive oil. Let the lamb soak in the marinade while in the refrigerator for 24 hours. Season the lamb. After the lamb is done marinating, season it with spices like salt, pepper or garlic powder. Grill the leg of lamb. Grill the cut of lamb on high for 3-4 minutes on either side. Lower the heat and cover your grill for up to 15 additional minutes to cook your leg of lamb the way you like it. Allow the juices to settle. Letting your leg of lamb cool after grilling will make a more flavorful meat.
